isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - REASSEMBLY

note.para: Adapter housing dowel pins will align the gasket and the adapter housing to the engine front plate.

step1.para: Tighten the adapter housing bolts, nuts and washers to the specified special torque (see "SPECIAL TORQUE").
Install the injection pump gear as follows:

note.para: VERIFY THAT THE ENGINE #1 CYLINDER IS ON THE COMPRESSION STROKE (TDC). ALSO VERIFY STATIC TIMING BY CHECKING THE TIMING POINTER AND DEGREE MARKS ON THE DAMPER PULLEY. REFER TO "SET INJECTION PUMP TO ENGINE TIMING PRIOR TO PUMP REMOVAL" IN THIS SECTION FOR A DETAILED PROCEDURE.

step2.para:
Loosely install the injection pump drive gear to the injection pump drive hub. DO NOT TIGHTEN BOLTS. Refer to Figure 11.36
.

note.para: Position bolts in the center of the kidney slotted holes.

step2.para:
Verify the alignment of the injection pump timing pointer to the drive hub scribe line through the adapter housing sight plug. Refer to Figure 11.37
. Rotate the pump gear and hub as required for proper alignment.
Tighten three pump drive gear mounting bolts to specified "SPECIAL TORQUE".

note.para: BE SURE THE TIMING POINTER AND SCRIBE LINE ARE STILL ALIGNED AFTER THE BOLTS ARE TIGHTENED.

step2.para: Reinstall timing plug using a new copper gasket.

figure.caption: Figure 11.35. Install Injection Pump and Housing Assembly to the Front Plate.
Figure 11.36. Install Injection Pump Drive Gear.
Figure 11.37. MW Injection Pump Timing Pointer and Timing Mark.

step1.para: Install the injection pump drive gear access cover using a new gasket as follows:

note.para: Prior to access cover installation, be sure to tighten the two engine front cover mounting bolts which will be covered by the access cover (Figure 11.38).

For engines equipped with a mechanical tachometer, install the drive adapter with new seal ring on the access cover. Be sure that the tang of the drive adapter engages the slot in the end of injection pump camshaft when access cover is installed.

step2.para:
Secure the three bolts and washers which fasten into the front cover casting. Refer to Figure 11.39
.
Secure the bolts, washers and nuts which mount through the access cover, front cover and adapter housing.
Tighten the fasteners to the standard torque. See Appendix.

step1.para:
Install the lube oil supply line as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.40
).

note.para: Current service MW and all PES6A lube oil supply lines are hose/tube assemblies for ease of installation and removal.

step2.para: Remove the protective cap at the crankcase oil outlet elbow and the pump oil inlet.
Install a new rubber sealing sleeve at the compression nut end of the tube.
Fasten the tube to the crankcase oil outlet tube and tighten the nut.
Using new copper gaskets, fasten the banjo fitting to the pump oil inlet with the hollow screw.

figure.caption: Figure 11.38. Tighten Front Cover Bolts - Prior to Installing the Access Cover.
Figure 11.39. Install Injection Pump Drive Gear Access Cover.
Figure 11.40. PES6A Injection Pump Lube Oil Supply Line.

step1.para:
If removed, install the electric shut-off solenoid as follows: (Refer to Figure 11.41
).

note.para: THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS ARE TO BE USED IF THE ELECTRIC "INTERNAL SWITCH" SOLENOID IS REINSTALLED ON AN MW PUMP. THE CURRENT SERVICE SOLENOID IS DESIGNATED AS "SWITCHLESS" AND REQUIRES DIFFERENT INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS WHICH BEGIN ON THE FOLLOWING PAGE.
Follow these procedures step by step to prevent solenoid burn out or internal damage to injection pump.

step2.para: Remove solenoid plunger from solenoid and cap opening.
Assemble solenoid to bracket and tighten bolts.
Assemble bracket to engine at front cover and crankcase mounting locations.
Assemble rod end to shutoff lever and tighten bolt. DO NOT connect rod end to adjusting rod at this time.
Thread adjusting rod to solenoid plunger until bottomed, then tighten locknut.

Reinstall plunger into solenoid, depress plunger to bottom, energize solenoid using a 12 volt D.C. power source with 8 ampere "slow blow" fuse protection ( Figure 11.42
). Be sure that positive lead is connected to positive terminal, negative to negative. When solenoid is mounted to engine, the positive terminal will be closest to engine water pump. The solenoid is to be energized through step g.
Lift shutoff lever and screw adjusting rod thread into rod end until shutoff lever just stops its downward movement.
Turn adjusting rod upper end Two Full Turns in opposite direction (raising shutoff lever) and tighten locknut against upper rod end.
De-energize solenoid.

figure.caption: Figure 11.41. "Internal Switch" Solenoid (Model MW Injection Pump Only).

step1.para: Assembly and adjusting steps a through h will ensure that solenoid plunger will be fully seated at bottom of stroke and internal injection pump shutoff lever will not contact internal housing stop tab nor interfere with injection pump fuel rack during "excess fuel" starting conditions. Shutoff stop screw has been factory preset limiting solenoid plunger total travel to approximately 25.4 mm (1.0 in.) from bottom of stroke (run position) to end of stroke (shutoff position).

Do not adjust shutoff lever stop screw. If stop screw position is changed, injection pump must be removed and stop screw position set on the test bench. When stop screw is improperly adjusted, control rack may not move sufficiently to stop fuel delivery or may damage internal injection pump rack stop.

step2.para: Cycle solenoid 3-4 times to assure proper operation. After cycling solenoid, make sure solenoid rubber boot is properly seated. With solenoid energized, there should be no chatter.

caution.para: DO NOT CYCLE MORE THAN 6 TIMES WITHIN ONE MINUTE. ADDITIONAL CYCLING MAY CAUSE PULL-IN COIL OVER-HEATING RESULTING IN BURNOUT.

note.para: INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS FOR "SWITCHLESS" TYPE SOLENOID ASSEMBLIES ON ENGINES WITH AN MW INJECTION PUMP AND PREVIOUSLY EQUIPPED WITH AN "INTERNAL SWITCH" SOLENOID.

FOR INSTALLATION AND ADJUSTMENT INSTRUCTIONS OF "SWITCHLESS" TYPE SOLENOID ASSEMBLIES ON ENGINES EQUIPPED WITH AN "MW' INJECTION PUMP FOLLOW "INSTALLATION OF NEW "SWITCHLESS" ELECTRIC SHUT-OFF AND "ADJUSTMENT OF NEW ELECTRIC "SWITCHLESS" SHUT-OFF SOLENOID".
